0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Hypovolemia: 12.5-25 g (250-500 mL) IV, repeat as needed

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Safety and efficacy in children not established

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• cardiopulmonary bypass
  • congestive heart failure
  • hypersensitivity to albumin
  • hypoproteinemia associated with chronic nephrosis, chronic cirrhosis, malabsorption, protein-losing enteropathies, pancreatic insufficiency, and undernutrition
  • increased or normal intravascular volume
  • renal insufficiency
  • severe anemia

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• hepatic dysfunction
  • plasma protein fraction is made from human plasma and products made from human plasma may contain infectious agents (hepatitis C)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Plasma protein fraction is used as a human plasma replacement. It increases blood volume and provides protein for osmotic effect.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • use only 16 gauge needles or dispensing pins with 20 mL or larger vial sizes; insert needles or dispensing pins only within the stopper area (marked by the raised ring)
  • administer some distance from any site of infection or trauma
  • rate should be adjusted according to clinical response and changes in blood pressure; risk of hypotension with rapid infusion (greater than 10 mL/min) 2156370
  • compatible with most common carbohydrate and electrolyte solutions
  • solution that has been frozen should not be used

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: blood pressure; especially with rapid infusion

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono: Despite screening and testing, human plasma products carry a remote risk of transmitting infectious agents. Risks and benefits should be discussed with patient by healthcare professional.
